title: Pixel (1) 128GB online manual & way to find/filter Pixel (1) help online - Pixel 3 'hits' are first
content:
Trying to find a Pixel (1) manual (?)  to read - figuring what questions to search for online is terribly inefficient & effectively out of date if find content is for a different model and Android version. I guess with any phone an OS update makes a manual outdated immediately, but I need to learn Pixel in an orderly way, not search for random questions based on trying to translate past experience with iOS 'terminology'.

I just bought an unopened Pixel 128GB (first edition)...I don't need a '3'. Switched from iPhone and despite having used Android tablets, I have to figure some very different things out. Some Android 9 features in this phone don't even match (random) help content which could be for an earlier version.

An example:

I really want to use the AF/AE lock touchscreen feature I had on past phones, and which Pixels supposedly have. It updated to Android 9 upon first powerup & touching the screen doesn't lock focus; it brings up Google Lens signup which is actually turned off/not installed in my settings. If I search for AF lock, I get latest Pixel 3 help or outdated 2016 Pixel help apparently superseded by OS updates. Maybe the feature was taken away. I'm temporarily trying other camera apps that have manual focus sliders...a workaround.
I assume Pixel 3 hardware differences from Pixel (1) are potentially as significant as differences between OS versions.

Nice phone, just a bumpy learning curve.

Thank you
